meta.name: description
meta.content: Request a transfer of the target resource

main.p: The GET method requests transfer of a current selected representation for the target resource. The resource may be a representation of another resource, for example, the resource http://example.com/index might be a listing of files, and http://example.com/index.html might be the particular HTML document representing that listing of files.
Clients should use use GET to download a specified document.
If the resource does not exist, return a 404 Not Found response.
If the resource is negotiated, determine which representation to return.
If conditional headers are present, test them and return 304 Not Modified as necessary.

Payloads on a GET request have no defined semantics; while servers can use the request payload for any purpose, intermediate nodes may also manipulate or drop the request payload. For sending documents to a server, that cannot be encoded into the request-URI due to length, see the SEARCH method.

dl.dd: Returns a representation of the resource

dd.a: RFC 5789: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content. 4.3.1. GET
